results.nextGrowth.title: Next Growth Actions
results.nextGrowth.subtitle: Based on your current account state, this is the most effective action order.
results.nextGrowth.cards.primary.title: Focus on One Action First
results.nextGrowth.cards.primary.body: Choose one action that you can realistically complete in the next 7 days. Consistency builds growth faster than doing many things at once.
results.nextGrowth.cards.lever.title: Increase Engagement Without Extra Work
results.nextGrowth.cards.lever.body: Add a simple interaction hook to your existing content to boost comments and shares without increasing posting frequency.
results.nextGrowth.cards.lever.items.0: End posts with a clear question
results.nextGrowth.cards.lever.items.1: Use A/B choices to invite comments
results.nextGrowth.cards.lever.items.2: State the pain point or outcome in the first line
results.nextGrowth.cards.optimize.title: Optimize Instead of Posting More
results.nextGrowth.cards.optimize.body: Select your top 3 best-performing posts and improve the hook, headline, or first visual. This outperforms publishing more new posts.
results.nextGrowth.cards.optimize.footno: Algorithms favor proven content variations over raw volume.
results.nextGrowth.footer: Growth comes from repeating the right actions ‚Äî not doing everything at once.

growthTasks.title: Your Growth Action Tasks
growthTasks.subtitle: Based on your current account performance

1.title: Lock a weekly posting cadence
1.desc: Pick a cadence you can sustain (e.g., 3 posts/week) to build distribution consistency.

expand.what: Commit to a repeatable weekly schedule so the algorithm and your audience learn what to expect.

steps.1: Pick one cadence you can keep for the next 14 days.
steps.2: Batch 3 post ideas and draft hooks in one sitting.
steps.3: Schedule your next week‚Äôs posts on your calendar.

expand.done: You publish on-time for 2 straight weeks without scrambling.

2.title: Turn a high-engagement topic into a series
2.desc: Ship 3 angles (how-to / example / checklist) to drive saves and repeat views.

expand.what: Build a 3-part series around one proven topic so people binge and save.

steps.1: Choose one post that already performed well.
steps.3: Cross-link them with a clear ‚ÄúPart 1/2/3‚Äù label.

expand.done: You publish the full 3-part series and can see a lift in saves or profile visits.

3.title: Optimize profile + pinned posts
3.desc: Clarify who you help + what you deliver, then pin your 3 strongest examples.

expand.what: Make your profile instantly understandable and pin your best proof to increase conversion.

steps.1: Rewrite your bio into: who you help + outcome + credibility proof.
steps.2: Pin 3 posts that represent your best work.
steps.3: Add one clear call-to-action (DM keyword or link).

expand.done: A new visitor can explain what you do in 5 seconds and knows the next action.

creatorReadiness.title: Creator Positioning & Collaboration Readiness
creatorReadiness.subtitle: A clean positioning snapshot based on your current account signals.

style.meaningBody: Your dominant content style‚Äîhow brands and followers will perceive your posts at a glance.
style.statusBody: Educational/practical positioning is clear, which helps trust and shareability.

next.1: Keep one repeatable format (template) to strengthen recognition.
next.2: Add 1‚Äì2 proof posts (results, case studies) to increase authority.

stage.meaningBody: Where your account is in its growth curve based on consistency and engagement signals.
stage.statusBody: You‚Äôre in a build phase‚Äîconsistency will compound outcomes faster than one-off spikes.

next.1: Protect your cadence for 2‚Äì4 weeks and review what repeats.
next.2: Turn one winning topic into a series to build momentum.

readiness.meaningBody: How ready your profile and content are for collaborations (clarity, proof, and consistency).
readiness.statusBody: You‚Äôre close‚Äîtighten proof and packaging so a brand can say ‚Äúyes‚Äù quickly.

next.1: Pin 3 proof posts that demonstrate your value.
next.2: Add one collaboration line (rates/media kit link or DM keyword).

setup.title: We can‚Äôt analyze this account yet
setup.subtitle: Meta requires a Professional IG account linked to a Facebook Page.

steps.1: Open Instagram ‚Üí Settings and privacy ‚Üí Account type and tools
steps.2: Switch to a Professional account (Business or Creator)
steps.3: In Meta Business Suite/Page settings, link your IG to your Facebook Page
steps.4: Come back here and click Retry

setup.tip: If you just linked it, wait a few seconds and try again (Meta sync can take time).

nextActions.title: Next actions
nextActions.subtitle: Get the order right and you‚Äôll usually see engagement improve within a week.
nextActions.ctaHint: Hit 70%+ to make your creator card look collaboration-ready.

checklist.profileBasics: Refresh avatar/bio: one line that clearly states your value
checklist.pin3: Pin 3 posts: intro, best work, and collab/DM entry point
checklist.pickOneTheme: Commit to one theme and win there first
checklist.hookOpen: Add a hook in the first second: question/contrast/result first
checklist.cutDeadTime: Cut dead time: every 2‚Äì3 seconds should change or add info
checklist.endWithCTA: End with a CTA: comment keyword, save, or next-episode teaser
checklist.askAB: Ask one interaction question per post (A/B works best)
checklist.reply10: Reply to the first 10 comments (boost repeat engagement)
checklist.repeatFormat: Repeat one winning format 5 times with small variations

nextActions.helperLine: üëâ These three actions most directly affect your growth in the next 30 days.

foundation.title: Fix the basics first
foundation.body: Make your profile worth following before you scale content.
foundation.item0: Refresh avatar + bio: one line that clearly states your value
foundation.item1: Pin 3 posts: intro, best work, and collab/DM entry point
foundation.item2: Commit to one theme and win there first

content.title: Increase hit rate
content.body: Win the first second: hook + pacing + a clear CTA.
content.item0: Start with a hook: question, contrast, or the result first
content.item1: Cut dead time: every 2‚Äì3 seconds should change or add info
content.item2: End with a CTA: comment keyword, save, or next-episode teaser

growth.title: Turn engagement into growth
growth.body: Make people stop, interact, and share.
growth.item0: Ask one interaction question per post (A/B works best)
growth.item1: Reply to the first 10 comments (boosts repeat engagement)
growth.item2: Repeat one winning format 5 times with small variations

nextActions.footer: Tip: For more precise recommendations based on your audience, format, and timing signals, Pro unlocks deeper insights and copy-ready scripts.

1.title: üëâ Pick one weekly theme
1.desc: Choose one repeatable topic and publish it twice this week.

2.title: üëâ Improve your hook
2.desc: Rewrite the first line to be specific and audience-first.

3.title: üëâ Copy what already works
3.desc: Turn your best post into a 3-part mini series with the same angle.

1.title: üëâ Lock a posting cadence
1.desc: Aim for 2 posts this week with the same topic and format.

2.title: üëâ Clarify your niche
2.desc: Write one sentence: who you help + what you share + why it matters.

3.title: üëâ Plan your next 10 posts
3.desc: Draft 10 titles in one sitting so you never run out of ideas.

1.title: üëâ Build a signature series
1.desc: Pick one format and run it 3 times with a consistent message.

2.title: üëâ Tighten your profile
2.desc: Make your bio and pinned posts say exactly what you‚Äôre about.

3.title: üëâ Create your content angles
3.desc: Define 5 angles you want to be known for, then rotate them.

1.title: üëâ Ask one clear question
1.desc: End every post with a simple question that invites replies.

2.title: üëâ Turn comments into content
2.desc: Pick one common comment and answer it as your next post.

3.title: üëâ Build a reply script
3.desc: Prepare quick reply templates to keep conversations flowing.

1.title: üëâ Start a weekly ritual
1.desc: Run a weekly prompt so your community expects to participate.

2.title: üëâ Feature your audience
2.desc: Share 1 follower story or comment and respond with your take.

3.title: üëâ Map your community topics
3.desc: List 8 discussion topics your audience loves and recycle them.

1.title: üëâ Write a clear offer
1.desc: Describe what you do in one line and who it‚Äôs for.

2.title: üëâ Add one proof post
2.desc: Post a short case study: problem ‚Üí process ‚Üí result.

3.title: üëâ Set an inquiry path
3.desc: Decide where inquiries go (DM or form) and mention it consistently.

1.title: üëâ Package 3 collaboration ideas
1.desc: Write 3 brand-safe content ideas you can deliver this month.

2.title: üëâ Create a media kit outline
2.desc: Summarize your niche, audience, and top posts in one page.

3.title: üëâ Draft your pitch message
3.desc: Prepare a short pitch you can send to brands in under 30 seconds.

1.title: üëâ Systemize your workflow
1.desc: Batch create: outline 5 posts today, film tomorrow, edit next.

2.title: üëâ Double down on winners
2.desc: Repeat your top-performing format with a new angle.

3.title: üëâ Plan your content calendar
3.desc: Build a simple 2-week calendar so your output stays consistent.

1.title: üëâ Choose one monetization path
1.desc: Pick one offer to focus on this month (service, product, or affiliate).

2.title: üëâ Create a simple CTA
2.desc: Add one consistent call-to-action in your posts and bio.

3.title: üëâ Build a conversion post
3.desc: Write one post that explains the problem and your solution clearly.

description.growthStage: You‚Äôre building your base. Focus on consistency and a clear topic so new people know why to follow.
description.personalBrand: Your engagement is promising. Next step is packaging your message so it reaches more people.
description.stableCreator: You‚Äôre showing up consistently with solid engagement. Keep your cadence and scale what‚Äôs working.
description.clientReady: People are replying and talking with you. You can start turning attention into leads with a clear offer.
description.brandCollaboration: You have both scale and strong engagement. You‚Äôre in a great spot to pitch and land brand partnerships.

proHint.rings: Subscribe to see a detailed breakdown

followers.title: Followers
followers.description: This week: tighten your topic and ship consistently so your audience base can grow.

engagementRate.title: Engagement Rate
engagementRate.description: Keep what‚Äôs working and simplify your message so more people engage faster.

avgLikes.title: Avg Likes
avgLikes.description: Repeat the format that gets likes and turn it into a 3-post mini series.

avgComments.title: Avg Comments
avgComments.description: End each post with one clear question to invite replies.

engagementVolume.title: Engagement Volume
engagementVolume.description: Double down on your best angle and post it again with a fresh hook.

postsPerWeek.title: Posts / Week
postsPerWeek.description: Pick a cadence you can keep and protect it for the next 2 weeks.

consequence.followers: If this stays flat, growth will feel slow even when you post more.
consequence.engagementRate: If this stays the same, reach tends to plateau because signals stay weak.
consequence.avgLikes: If this stays low, new viewers won‚Äôt get a clear reason to follow.
consequence.avgComments: If this stays low, you‚Äôll get fewer warm conversations and DMs.
consequence.engagementVolume: If this stays flat, your best posts won‚Äôt compound over time.
consequence.postsPerWeek: If this stays inconsistent, it‚Äôs harder for people (and algorithms) to expect you.

goals.title: What's your current goal?
goals.subtitle: Choose one focus to see how your current metrics support that goal.

followers.note: A solid follower base helps your growth efforts compound.

engagementRate.note: Engagement indicates whether new viewers convert into followers.

avgLikes.note: Likes help distribution, but consistency matters more for growth.

avgComments.note: Comments signal stronger intent and can accelerate reach.

engagementVolume.note: Total interactions show momentum that can drive discovery.

postsPerWeek.note: A steady posting rhythm gives you more chances to grow.

followers.note: A growing audience helps your message reach more people.

engagementRate.note: High engagement suggests your positioning resonates.

avgLikes.note: Likes reflect quick agreement and reinforce your brand cues.

avgComments.note: Comments help deepen trust and clarify what people care about.

engagementVolume.note: Momentum helps your ideas spread beyond your core followers.

postsPerWeek.note: Consistency helps your audience learn what you stand for.

followers.note: Followers are useful, but conversations are what drive traffic.

engagementRate.note: Engagement supports distribution, especially when comments are strong.

avgLikes.note: Likes help, but they don‚Äôt always translate to clicks or replies.

avgComments.note: Comments indicate high intent and can boost reach significantly.

engagementVolume.note: High interaction volume keeps posts circulating longer.

postsPerWeek.note: Posting regularly gives you more chances to invite action.

followers.note: Community growth is steady when people feel connected.

engagementRate.note: Engagement rate reflects community health and responsiveness.

avgLikes.note: Likes show lightweight support; comments show belonging.

avgComments.note: Comments help your community interact with you and each other.

engagementVolume.note: Consistent interaction volume signals strong community loops.

postsPerWeek.note: A predictable cadence keeps the community returning.

followers.note: Followers help credibility, but clarity converts clients.

engagementRate.note: Engagement suggests trust signals‚Äîimportant for inbound leads.

avgLikes.note: Likes reflect attention; combine with proof posts for conversion.

avgComments.note: Comments can reveal objections you can address with content.

engagementVolume.note: Momentum helps your expertise get seen by the right people.

postsPerWeek.note: Consistency builds trust and reduces perceived risk.

followers.note: Audience size matters, but consistency and fit matter too.

engagementRate.note: Strong engagement is a common signal for brand partners.

avgLikes.note: Likes show broad appeal; keep content brand-safe and repeatable.

avgComments.note: Comments can indicate trust and product relevance.

engagementVolume.note: High interaction volume can improve partnership attractiveness.

postsPerWeek.note: Regular posting creates more partnership-ready examples.

followers.note: Audience growth compounds, but systems keep you consistent.

engagementRate.note: Engagement indicates whether your formats are working.

avgLikes.note: Likes provide fast feedback loops for iteration.

avgComments.note: Comments can build retention and increase distribution.

engagementVolume.note: Momentum helps you learn what to double down on.

postsPerWeek.note: A repeatable publishing rhythm is key to full-time creation.

followers.note: A larger audience helps, but intent and trust drive revenue.

avgLikes.note: Likes are attention; pair them with clear offers and proof.

avgComments.note: Comments can reveal demand and questions you can convert.

engagementVolume.note: High total interactions often correlate with higher intent.

postsPerWeek.note: Consistency keeps your offer and message top of mind.

growFollowers.role: This metric helps you estimate whether your content earns reactions that lead to follow intent.
growFollowers.status: Your current performance suggests a stable foundation, with room to improve consistency.
growFollowers.action: Next step: repeat one high-performing format weekly and tighten the first line hook.

increaseLikes.role: This metric shows whether your posts reliably earn lightweight positive feedback.
increaseLikes.status: Your current performance looks steady, with opportunities to sharpen what resonates.
increaseLikes.action: Next step: test two visual-first formats and keep the best one for the next 5 posts.

increaseComments.role: This metric reflects how often your content triggers conversation, not just quick reactions.
increaseComments.status: Your current performance indicates engagement is present, but discussion could deepen.
increaseComments.action: Next step: add a specific question or a two-choice prompt and pin the best reply.

boostReach.role: This metric helps you track whether you are giving the algorithm enough consistent opportunities to distribute.
boostReach.status: Your current performance appears workable, but reach typically improves with steadier cadence.
boostReach.action: Next step: set a fixed weekly schedule and maintain it for two cycles before adjusting.

buildPersonalBrand.role: This metric indicates whether your content earns trust and relevance signals from the audience.
buildPersonalBrand.status: Your current performance suggests you have a base signal, but messaging clarity can improve.
buildPersonalBrand.action: Next step: keep one consistent point of view and repeat it across a three-post series.

getBrandDeals.role: This metric is a proxy for audience quality and how strongly your content holds attention.
getBrandDeals.status: Your current performance shows a reasonable baseline, with room to improve signal strength.
getBrandDeals.action: Next step: publish one case-study style post and track which angle gets the most responses.

becomeCreator.role: This metric reflects whether your publishing system is consistent enough to learn and iterate.
becomeCreator.status: Your current performance looks sustainable, but consistency is the main lever to strengthen.
becomeCreator.action: Next step: lock a repeatable weekly rhythm and batch-produce your next week‚Äôs posts.

monetizeConsistently.role: This metric helps you validate whether attention translates into meaningful interest over time.
monetizeConsistently.status: Your current performance shows early signals, but outcomes benefit from a clearer offer narrative.
monetizeConsistently.action: Next step: add one clear call-to-action in a weekly post and keep it consistent for a month.

followers.role: Followers show the size of your current audience base.
followers.note: Make your profile and content theme consistent so new visitors know why to follow.

engagementRate.role: Engagement rate shows whether your content makes people want to react.
engagementRate.note: Use one clear hook and repeat what works for a week to improve consistency.

avgLikes.role: Likes are quick signals that your posts are easy to agree with.
avgLikes.note: Turn your best post style into a repeatable format people recognize.

avgComments.role: Comments show deeper interest and can increase distribution.
avgComments.note: End posts with one specific question to invite replies.

engagementVolume.role: Total interactions reflect whether your account is building momentum.
engagementVolume.note: Aim for a consistent cadence and reuse winning topics to keep momentum up.

postsPerWeek.note: Keep a simple weekly schedule so you can improve through repetition.

badges.modeHint: A = inferred / estimated. C = official / connected.
badges.inferredDesc: is an estimate from visible signals. Official (C) requires a connected account.

overview.threadsNote: Threads-related insights are inferred from content cadence and engagement overlap signals.

insights.whyThisMatters: Why this matters: these signals affect reach, saves, and your ability to repeat what works.
insights.proHint: üîí Detailed explanation & actionable breakdown in Pro

0.title: Strong Engagement Rate
0.description: You're already outperforming the baseline‚Äîyour audience consistently reacts to your content. Next: pick 1‚Äì2 winning formats and repeat them weekly, aiming to increase saves + comments with a clear hook in the first line.

1.title: Optimal Posting Frequency
1.description: Your cadence is healthy and sustainable, which is a strong predictor of steady reach. Next: lock a repeatable weekly rhythm (e.g., 4‚Äì5 posts) and track what happens when you shift timing by 1‚Äì2 hours.

2.title: Comments Drive Visibility
2.description: Your best posts generate more comments‚Äîoften a signal that boosts distribution. Next: add a specific question or an A/B choice prompt, and pin the best reply to keep the thread active.

insights.title: Account Insights

demoNotes.1: This page is a demo output and does not access or store real social data.
demoNotes.2: Metrics and recommendations are model-inferred, not official platform analytics.
demoNotes.3: Use as a decision reference and validate against your actual performance data.

summary.nextStepEngagement: Next step: strengthen hooks and comment velocity
summary.nextStepAutomation: Next step: reduce automation patterns and stabilize activity
summary.nextStepExecute: Next step: execute the top three improvements this week

copy.disclaimer: This report reflects inferred analysis based on public signals, not official platform-provided metrics.

authenticity.title: Account Authenticity
authenticity.desc: Signals consistent with organic human-like activity based on public engagement patterns.
authenticity.note: This is an inferred signal, not a verification of identity.

engagement.title: Engagement Quality
engagement.desc: Evaluated using publicly observable interaction depth, comment structure, and engagement consistency.

automation.title: Automation Risk
automation.desc: Confidence score indicating likelihood of automated-like or abnormal activity patterns based on timing and interaction signals.

toast.connectSoon: Connect flow will be enabled after OAuth setup

performance.title: How your account performs across growth-critical dimensions
performance.radarDesc: Use the radar chart to quickly understand your account‚Äôs structure across content, engagement, frequency, growth, and monetization.
performance.howToInterpret: How to interpret: prioritize the lowest dimension first; it usually caps overall growth.

authenticity.title: Account Authenticity
authenticity.desc: Measures how authentic the account appears based on behavior patterns.

engagement.title: Engagement Quality
engagement.desc: Evaluates the quality and authenticity of engagement.

overview.title: Account Strength Overview
overview.subtitle: Visual representation of key performance indicators

growthPotential.label: Growth Potential
growthPotential.desc: Potential for audience growth based on current metrics

commercialValue.label: Commercial Value
commercialValue.desc: Attractiveness to potential sponsors and advertisers

collaborationReadiness.label: Collaboration Readiness
collaborationReadiness.desc: Suitability for brand partnerships and collaborations

monetization.title: Monetization Readiness
monetization.subtitle: Based on historical patterns observed across similar public creator profiles.

paywall.stat: Only 18% of accounts with this profile consistently monetize.
paywall.desc: Best for creators and teams who want a repeatable revenue path without sacrificing growth.

items.actionPlan: Priority action plan for the next 14 days

paywall.note: You‚Äôll receive a clear plan, priorities, and platform-specific actions.

next.title: Recommended Next Actions
next.subtitle: A focused 3-step plan mapped to the strongest signals and current constraints.
next.desc1: Standardize your posting format and cadence for the next 7 days to stabilize distribution.
next.desc2: Tighten your hook and early CTA to lift retention and drive higher-quality comments.
next.desc3: Unlock the monetization roadmap to prioritize the highest-impact revenue actions.

s1.title: Improve content consistency
s1.line2: Focus on a repeatable format and cadence for the next 7 days.

s2.title: Optimize engagement hooks
s2.line1: Increase early retention and qualified interactions.
s2.line2: Use clearer CTAs and comment prompts in the first 2 lines.

s3.title: Activate monetization signals
s3.line2: Introduce consistent callouts to offers, case studies, or lead magnets.

copyable.title: Copyable Summary
copyable.subtitle: Share a compact snapshot with your team or clients.
copyable.disclaimer: Analysis is based on publicly observable data, historical patterns, and inferred behavioral models. No private data or direct account access is used.

footer.line: Used by creators, agencies, and growth teams to evaluate social account potential.
footer.proPitchTitle: Need deeper official benchmarks and comparisons?
footer.proPitchDesc: If you‚Äôre ready to turn this report into an actionable growth plan.
footer.proModalDesc: Pro includes a clearer strategy, reusable templates, and a prioritized growth roadmap.

proModalBullets.1: A clearer strategy with step-by-step execution
proModalBullets.2: A prioritized roadmap (what to do first, next, later)
proModalBullets.3: More copy-ready content and engagement templates

post.title: Single Post Analysis
post.subtitle: Inferred insights from public signals. Official post metrics are only shown after explicit platform authorization.
post.modeExplain:
A (Inferred): based on public observable signals and inferred models.
C (Official): shown only after explicit platform authorization.

url.hint: Paste an Instagram post or Reels link (instagram.com/p/... or instagram.com/reel/...)
url.invalid: Invalid link. Please paste an Instagram post or Reels link.

post.freeExhaustedDesc: Upgrade to continue unlimited post analysis.
post.freeExhaustedHint: Free limit reached ¬∑ Upgrade to unlock unlimited post & account analysis.

loading.resultsDesc: Preparing inferred signals and draft recommendations‚Ä¶

preview.title: Post Preview
preview.subtitle: Shows a preview of public post info.
preview.caption: Caption (mock):
preview.note1: No image parsing is performed. This preview is a placeholder for UI flow.
preview.note2: This preview is UI-only and does not fetch or parse the post content.

body.success: Content quality and actual performance are aligned ‚Äî this is a successful post you can replicate.

okButLow.hook: Content quality is solid, but actual reach is lagging ‚Äî the biggest bottleneck is the hook not grabbing attention fast enough.
okButLow.clarity: Content quality is solid, but actual reach is lagging ‚Äî the main bottleneck is unclear messaging.
okButLow.generic: Content quality is solid, but actual reach is lagging ‚Äî focus on the first 1‚Äì2 seconds and make the value obvious.

low.low: Both content quality and actual performance are low ‚Äî prioritize fixing the content fundamentals first.
low.hook: Content quality needs improvement ‚Äî start by tightening the hook so viewers understand the value immediately.
low.generic: Content quality needs improvement ‚Äî simplify the message and improve readability.

body.neutral: This post is in the middle ‚Äî apply the top recommendation below for the fastest improvement.

quick.title: Quick Recommendations
quick.subtitle: Expandable suggestions based on inferred friction points.

fallback.hook: Make the hook explicit in the first seconds
fallback.visual: Improve readability and contrast on mobile

unlock.title: Unlock official post performance
unlock.subtitle: Authorize to view platform-provided metrics and benchmarks (C mode).
unlock.note: Read-only authorization. No posting and no DM access.

items.3: Publishing time and early interaction impact (official)

preview.note: Subscribe to view complete official metrics and recommendations comparison.

health.title: Post Health Summary
health.subtitle: Inferred indicators based on publicly observable signals and patterns.
health.note: This section is inferred guidance, not official analytics.

hook.title: Hook Strength
hook.detail: Signals suggest the first-frame value proposition is present but may not be explicit enough for cold viewers.

clarity.title: Content Clarity
clarity.detail: Likely impacted by dense phrasing or competing focal points that increase cognitive load.

readability.title: Visual Readability
readability.detail: Signals suggest on-screen text hierarchy and contrast may reduce fast comprehension on mobile.

interaction.title: Interaction Cues
interaction.detail: Likely impacted by CTA placement; the cue exists but may not be strong enough to trigger comments or saves.

dropoff.title: Drop-off Risk
dropoff.detail: Signals suggest early-scrolling or swipe-away risk due to delayed payoff within the first seconds.

underperform.title: Why This Post May Underperform
underperform.subtitle: Consultant-style diagnosis based on likely constraints (non-accusatory, inferred).

reasons.1: The initial hook may not clearly communicate the value within the first visible frame.
reasons.2: Visual hierarchy may increase interpretation cost, especially on small screens.
reasons.3: Interaction prompts are present, but likely not specific enough to drive replies or saves.

rewrite.title: Actionable Rewrite Suggestions
rewrite.subtitle: Copy-ready rewrites and visual guidance based on inferred friction points.

hooks.1: If you're doing X, you're losing reach ‚Äî here's the 10‚Äësecond fix.
hooks.2: Most creators miss this one signal. Fix it, and your next post performs better.
hooks.3: Before you post today, check this ‚Äî it likely affects distribution.

ctas.1: Comment 'PLAN' and I'll share the checklist.
ctas.2: Save this for your next post ‚Äî and tell me which part you'd improve first.

visuals.1: Keep the first on-screen line under ~7 words and lead with a single keyword.
visuals.2: Align text to one edge and increase contrast for fast scanning.
visuals.3: Use one primary focal point per frame; avoid competing callouts.

publicEngagement.title: Public Engagement
publicEngagement.subtitle: Based on publicly visible interaction data

engagementRateHelp.title: Engagement Rate Explained
engagementRateHelp.body: Engagement rate = (likes + comments) / followers √ó 100. This metric requires follower count to calculate.
engagementRateHelp.missingFollowers: Follower count required to calculate engagement rate

emptyState.title: Instagram Insights Not Authorized
emptyState.message: Instagram Insights not authorized. Official metrics unavailable. Public engagement metrics are still visible above.

connect.title: Connect Your Instagram Account
connect.body: Authorize to view official reach, impressions, saves, shares, and more.

errors.mappingFailedBody: Could not retrieve post ID from the URL. Please verify the link is correct.
errors.fetchFailedBody: Could not fetch official insights for this post. Please try again later.

error.forbidden: Permission missing. Please verify app permissions and IG business connection.
error.generic: Unable to load official metrics right now.

interpretation.seenButLowRetention: It was seen, but retention/engagement seems weak ‚Äî the opening may not be holding attention.
interpretation.distribution: Quality looks OK, but reach is underwhelming ‚Äî this may be timing/distribution rather than content.
interpretation.content: Reach and quality are both low ‚Äî improving the content fundamentals will matter most.

vsAvg.title: Compared to account average
vsAvg.note: Benchmarking uses your recent post baseline after authorization.

contrast.title: Content Quality vs Actual Performance
contrast.subtitle: A diagnostic contrast between inferred quality and observed outcomes
contrast.note: This suggests distribution or timing constraints rather than content quality issues.

body.distribution: High quality but low reach ‚Äî focus on distribution and the first seconds of the hook.
body.content: Quality and reach are both low ‚Äî prioritize improving the core message and clarity.
body.success: Quality and reach are both strong ‚Äî document what worked and replicate it.
body.mixed: Signals are mixed ‚Äî apply the top recommendation first and re-check results.

action.closing: If you only apply the single "Most important" recommendation above, performance usually improves noticeably.

snapshot.title: Copyable Snapshot
snapshot.subtitle: A compact summary you can paste into a doc or share with a client.

export.notOfficial: Not official metrics unless C mode is explicitly authorized.

nextGrowth.title: Next Growth Actions
nextGrowth.subtitle: Based on your current account state, this is the most effective action order.

primary.title: Focus on One Action First
primary.body: Choose one action that you can realistically complete in the next 7 days. Consistency builds growth faster than doing many things at once.

lever.title: Increase Engagement Without Extra Work
lever.body: Add a simple interaction hook to your existing content to boost comments and shares without increasing posting frequency.
lever.item0: End posts with a clear question
lever.item1: Use A/B choices to invite comments
lever.item2: State the pain point or outcome in the first line

optimize.title: Optimize Instead of Posting More
optimize.body: Select your top 3 best-performing posts and improve the hook, headline, or first visual. This outperforms publishing more new posts.
optimize.footnote: Algorithms favor proven content variations over raw volume.

nextGrowth.footer: Growth comes from repeating the right actions ‚Äî not doing everything at once.
